title: The Six That Sent New Zealand to the World Cup Final: Grant Elliott's Epic Moment
content:
The 2015 World Cup semi-final between New Zealand and South Africa was a nail-biter, with the Kiwis needing 12 runs from the final over. Enter Grant Elliott, a South African-born Kiwi who had made his mark on the international stage. With the pressure mounting, Elliott faced Dale Steyn, South Africa's star bowler. In a moment that etched itself into cricket history, Elliott launched a six off the fifth ball, sending the crowd into a frenzy and securing New Zealand's first-ever World Cup final appearance. 

This dramatic finish showcased the unpredictable nature of cricket and the power of a single moment to shift the course of a tournament. For Elliott, it was a moment of personal triumph and a symbol of New Zealand's resilience. For South Africa, it was a heart-breaking defeat that prolonged their wait for a World Cup final.
author: Ashish Magotra
